page.title: 16Tame Valley Canal.
page.content: In general a pleasant, well maintained residential area containing both owner-occupied and council property. Most streets have been planted with trees, now mature. Adding to the pleasantness of the environment is the landscaping of the open land along{Woden Road South} bordering the{River Tame.}Prior to infilling and landscaping (about 1970) this flood marsh of the{Tame}was a habitat for frogs, toads and many birds-including{Warblers.}The pool adjacent to the College supports wild fowl including migrating{Canada geese. The{Tame Canal}is increasingly used for leisure traffic. Detrcating from the overall cleanliness was an area at the bottom of{Kilvert Road}that showed decay and dereliction, urgently in need of repearation.
